sen.j: 津崎 矩子（つざき のりこ、天明6年（1786年） - 明治6年（1873年）8月23日）は幕末の近衛家の老女、勤王家。
sen.e: Noriko TSUZAKI (1786 - August 23, 1873) was a senior lady-in-waiting in the Konoe family and person loyal to the emperor who lived towards the end of the Edo bakufu period.

sen.j: 女中名は最初田鶴、須賀野、後に村岡局と称した。
sen.e: As a house maid, she called herself Tazu initially, then Sugano and later, Muraoka no Tsubone.

sen.j: 父は大覚寺門跡家臣津崎左京、兄は大覚寺門跡諸大夫の津崎元矩。
sen.e: Her father was Sakyo TSUZAKI, a retainer of Daikakuji monseki (head priest of Daikaku-ji temple), and his elder brother was Motonori TSUZAKI, Shodaibu (aristocracy lower than Kugyo) of Daikakuji monseki.

sen.j: 寛政10年（1798年）より近衛家に仕えて、中臈を経て老女となり、村岡局を名乗った。
sen.e: She served the Konoe family from 1798, became a senior lady-in-waiting after assuming a middle grade lady-in-waiting and called herself Muraoka no Tsubone.

sen.j: 近衛忠熙に仕えて信頼を得た。
sen.e: She earned Tadahiro KONOE's trust through her service to him.

sen.j: また勤皇活動に熱心で水戸藩家老 安島帯刀や薩摩藩藩士 西郷隆盛、勤王僧 月照、梅田雲浜などの勤王家と盛んに交流した。
sen.e: In addition, being also enthusiastic about activities for supporting Emperor, she had intimate relationships with persons royal to Emperor, such as Tatewaki AJIMA, Karo (chief retainer) of the Mito domain, Takamori SAIGO, a retainer of the Satsuma domain, Gessho, a priest royal to Emperor and Unpin UMEDA.

sen.j: 安政5年（1858年）の安政の大獄では、京都町奉行所の厳しい取調べの後、関東に送られ、押込30日に処せられた。
sen.e: In Ansei no Taigoku (suppression of extremists by the Shogunate) in 1858, she was harshly interrogated at a town magistrate's office in Kyoto, then was sent to Kanto, and was confined in a place for 30 days.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）にも、尊王攘夷運動の活発化に伴い嫌疑を受け、幕府に捕えられている。
sen.e: As Sonno Joi Movement (the Movement advocating reverence for Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners) was increasingly more intensified, her involvement in the movement was suspected and she was captured by the bakufu.

sen.j: 維新後は賞典禄20石を賜り、郷里の北嵯峨の直指庵で余生を送った。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, she was awarded 3.6 cubic meters of crop yields as Shotenroku (premium), and lived her remaining life at Jikishi-an Temple in Kita-saga that was her hometown.

sen.j: 文政8年（1825年）に江戸より輿入れした忠熙の正室・郁姫（島津斉宣娘、島津斉興養女）やお付の上臈・幾島とは折り合いが悪かったと言われている。
